sources.data_found: Sherlock Cluster Facts: Lists '2,057 compute nodes' and a heterogeneous mix of GPU resources available to the university community.
Sherlock 4.0 Upgrade: Adds new GPU partitions including SH4_G4TF64 (4x H100 SXM5 per node) and SH4_G4FP32 (4x L40S per node).

student_data.notes: Exact enrollment counts by major are not publicly tabulated on a single page. Undergrad Estimate: Based on Stanford Facts reporting 1,758 bachelor's degrees and Computer Science representing ~18% of degrees (historically ~300-315/year). 316 degrees/year × 4 years = 1,264 estimated CS majors. Grad/PhD Estimates: Based on typical cohort sizes (approx 400 MS students in residence and ~50 PhD graduates/year × 5.5 years duration). [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

gpu_resources.notes: Total H100 SXM Calculation: Marlowe Cluster (32 nodes × 8 GPUs = 256) + HAI Cluster (~40 est) + SC Cluster (8 verified) + Sherlock 4.0 public/owner nodes (~64 est) = 368 total. A100 Counts: Derived from SC Cluster partition lists (63) + Sherlock estimated inventory (~600 split between 40GB/80GB based on acquisition years). H200 Count: Based on Sherlock catalog node type SH4_G8TF64.1 availability (estimated 4 nodes x 8). [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

analysis_notes: Data aggregated from Stanford Data Science (Marlowe), Stanford Research Computing (Sherlock), and Department of Computer Science (SC Cluster) sources. Marlowe is a distinct DGX SuperPOD separate from the general Sherlock condo cluster.
